paragraphs.content: Psalm 83
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 83

paragraphs.content: A Song or Psalm of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Song or Psalm of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.

paragraphs.content: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

paragraphs.content: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.

paragraphs.content: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

paragraphs.content: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:

paragraphs.content: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;
paragraphs.contentHtml: The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;

paragraphs.content: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;

paragraphs.content: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Do unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:

paragraphs.content: Which perished at En-dor: they became as dung for the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which perished at En-dor: they became as dung for the earth.

paragraphs.content: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:

paragraphs.content: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.

paragraphs.content: O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.

paragraphs.content: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;

paragraphs.content: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.

paragraphs.content: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O Lord.

paragraphs.content: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:

paragraphs.content: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH, art the most high over all the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That men may know that thou, whose name alone is Jehovah, art the most high over all the earth.
